comments.body: Though honestly this doesn't look so bad to me.
Yeah.  I could try removing the `--with-python` perhaps
Is the `--with-libiconv` support to have a path? Should we be using `--with-pcre` too? Not sure if there are any more `--with-*` we should fill in.
`--with-libiconv` is needed so it compiles.  Not sure about `--with-pcre`, though it is a dependency.  Maybe we can worry about this in the feedstock too?
I don't think I have ever seen this. What is this doing?
This is a custom thing for one of the patches. I just copied this directly, though I could probably pretty easily change it to another variable name if you'd like.

comments.body: Are we brave enough to try `make check`? I forget whether they provided the option or not.
Fortune favors **the**. I'll try it after the current experiment.

There is an extraneous error that causes the check to fail. Can't find any info about it, so it is probably a bug

```
PASS: fileutils 1 /fileutils/build-path
PASS: fileutils 2 /fileutils/build-pathv
PASS: fileutils 3 /fileutils/build-filename
PASS: fileutils 4 /fileutils/build-filenamev
PASS: fileutils 5 /fileutils/mkdir-with-parents
PASS: fileutils 6 /fileutils/format-size-for-display
PASS: fileutils 7 /fileutils/errors
PASS: fileutils 8 /fileutils/basename
PASS: fileutils 9 /fileutils/dir-make-tmp
PASS: fileutils 10 /fileutils/file-open-tmp
PASS: fileutils 11 /fileutils/mkstemp
PASS: fileutils 12 /fileutils/mkdtemp
PASS: fileutils 13 /fileutils/set-contents
PASS: fileutils 14 /fileutils/read-link
ERROR: fileutils - too few tests run (expected 15, got 14)
ERROR: fileutils - exited with status 134 (terminated by signal 6?)
```
Was just looking at that. Not finding lots of info ATM.

Looks like the issue is we are missing `desktop-file-utils` according [LFS](http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/blfs/view/svn/general/glib2.html). It appears to have a cyclic dependency with `glib`. So, we might have to do the same thing we did with `bison` and `flex`, which is build one (with tests disabled) and then build the other. Finally, we enable the tests after both are built.
